original_definition: 'heavy-duty cabinet' means a professional refrigerated storage cabinet capable of continuously maintaining chilled or frozen operating temperature in all its compartment(s) in ambient conditions corresponding to climate class 5, as detailed in Table 3 of Annex IV;
generated_definition: 'heavy-duty cabinet' means a cabinet designed for heavy-duty use, typically with a high volume and/or weight capacity, and often used in commercial or industrial settings.

Article 2: ‘heavy-duty cabinet’ means aprofessional refrigerated storage cabinet capable of continuously maintaining chilled or frozen operating temperature in all its compartment(s) in ambient conditions corresponding to climate class 5, as detailed in Table 3 of Annex IV;

‘heavy-duty cabinet’ means a professional refrigerated storage cabinet capable of continuously maintaining chilled or frozen operating temperature in all its compartment(s) in ambient conditions corresponding to climate class 5, as detailed in Table 3 of Annex IV;
Article 3: heavy-duty cabinets shall comply with the requirements set out in point 1(b) and 2(a) of Annex II.
Article 8: From 1 July 2016, heavy-duty cabinets shall have an EEI lower than 115.
for heavy-duty cabinets, it shall be indicated that ‘This appliance is intended for use in ambient temperatures up to 40 °C’;
